Farms all across #MI06 have been impacted by extreme weather. I listened to their concerns, and we're going to get them help. 

More from @WSJM ➡️ https://www.wsjm.com/2019/07/02/video-upton-visits-farms-impacted-by-bad-weather/ …

My ag visits w/ farmers, growers & ag leaders was instructive. This farm year is worse than ever before. No one remembers a season like this when you had the hard freeze, the polar vortex & then you have rain every single day. Our farmers need help:  https://www.abc57.com/news/farmers-show-rep-upton-the-challenges-theyre-facing-this-year … #MI06

I spent yesterday seeing thousands of acres of empty farm fields. Because of the record rain & other extreme weather, our farmers are facing unique challenges. It’s heartbreaking. 

Learn more at @wwmtnews: https://wwmt.com/news/local/eyeing-michigan-farm-damage-first-hand-us-rep-fred-upton-renews-calls-for-relief …
The extreme rainfall has ruined some of the fields, meaning our farmers and growers simply can’t plant. #MI06 pic.twitter.com/wV3RvTBBc7

Thank you Hood Dairy Farms for hosting us today. Next stop on our ag visits is Gibson Farms In Scotts, MI. We’ve had instructive conversations with our farmers, growers, and ag leaders today. #MI06 pic.twitter.com/sGMErojFw3

With Todd Kubiszak at his farm - where usually he’d have corn planted - but his fields are ruined because of the extreme weather this year. And he said there are hundreds and hundreds of acres across #MI06 in a similar situation. Bottom line - farmers & growers need help. pic.twitter.com/CGq1GAgFwn

Important discussion w/ local farmers in Paw Paw. Nearly 38 inches of rain fell last year, making it one of the wettest years in MI’s history. This rain comes after other severe weather we’ve seen, including heavy snowfall, extreme temperatures, flash flooding, & tornadoes #MI06 pic.twitter.com/tvRSAcKo7O

Thanks, Russ, for hosting us at Costanza Farms. We’re headed to Paw Paw for the next farm visit of the day - Hood Dairy Farms. Dairy Farmers are facing unique challenges because there will be a lack of feed for their animals since other farms are unable to plant. #MI06

At Russ’ farm - who plants tomatoes, corn, and vegetables - planting is behind because of all of the extreme weather we had this year. Our farmers in SW Michigan and across the state need help. #MI06 pic.twitter.com/YMEPBuIPkL

The first stop of today’s farm visits is in Sodus, MI at Russell Costanza Farms - meeting with Russ and other local farmers to discuss their challenges following one of the wettest years in MI history. #MI06 pic.twitter.com/BHKt6WZiZd

Having grown up on the shores of Lake Michigan, I know full well the beauty of the Great Lakes & the positive impact they have on our state. 

Asian Carp would ruin the Great Lakes, so you can expect a bipartisan fight to keep Asian Carp OUT. ➡️ https://upton.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=401229 …

If Asian Carp were to get into our Great Lakes, they would threaten our region’s $7 billion fishing and $16 billion boating industries - and could decimate Michigan’s $20 billion tourism industry. 

The bottom line - we can not let Asian Carp into our Great Lakes. pic.twitter.com/dB4cW9VkPV

The plan the Army Corps has developed to stop Asian Carp at the Brandon Road Lock & Dam includes using sound, air bubbles, an electric barrier, + more. Funding is absolutely critical to PROTECT our Great Lakes from Asian Carp. 

And we’ll work together to get it done. pic.twitter.com/tqHLeJRyht

The Brandon Road Lock & Dam is a critical chokepoint for keeping Asian Carp out of our beautiful Great Lakes. Today’s visit gives Michigan Congressional members an opportunity to tour the facility and see firsthand where recommended enhancements should be made to stop Asian Carp pic.twitter.com/4C8wMntlBa

At the Brandon Road Lock & Dam with members of the Michigan Delegation to discuss with the Army Corps of Engineers our efforts to keep Asian Carp OUT of our beautiful Great Lakes. 

We must succeed in order to protect our fishing, boating, and tourism industries. pic.twitter.com/RKvzc5cmou

Chatting w/ @MPShiels at 7:45 to discuss our visit to Brandon Road Lock & Dam & our efforts to keep Asian Carp out of the Great Lakes.

We’ll also preview our farm tour tomorrow where we’ll see SW MI farms impacted by this year’s extreme rainfall.
